definition[0]: if someone or something deflects something that is moving, or if it deflects, it turns in a different direction
example[0]: He deflected the blow with his forearm.
definition[1]: to do something to stop people paying attention to you, criticizing you etc
example[1]: his attempts to deflect attention away from his private life
example[2]: The committee is seeking to deflect criticism by blaming me.
definition[2]: to take someoneâ€™s attention away from something
example[3]: Nothing can deflect me from reaching my goal.
